intro: Acinodendron cruentum, commonly known as the bloodroot tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red-orange sap, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences. Acinodendron cruentum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
